com.welie.blessed

Class BluetoothCentral

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.welie.blessed.BluetoothCentral

  • public class BluetoothCentral
extends java.lang.Object
    Central class to connect and communicate with bluetooth peripherals.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int SCAN_FAILED_ALREADY_STARTED
      Failed to start scan as BLE scan with the same settings is already started by the app.
      static int SCAN_FAILED_APPLICATION_REGISTRATION_FAILED
      Failed to start scan as app cannot be registered.
      static int SCAN_FAILED_FEATURE_UNSUPPORTED
      Failed to start power optimized scan as this feature is not supported.
      static int SCAN_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR
      Failed to start scan due an internal error
      static int SCAN_FAILED_OUT_OF_HARDWARE_RESOURCES
      Failed to start scan as it is out of hardware resources.
      static int SCAN_FAILED_SCANNING_TOO_FREQUENTLY
      Failed to start scan as application tries to scan too frequently.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes BluetoothCentral and cleans up internals. BluetoothCentral will not work anymore after this is called.

      • setScanMode

        public boolean setScanMode(int scanMode)
        Set the default scanMode.

        Must be ScanSettings.SCAN_MODE_LOW_POWER, ScanSettings.SCAN_MODE_LOW_LATENCY, ScanSettings.SCAN_MODE_BALANCED or ScanSettings.SCAN_MODE_OPPORTUNISTIC. The default value is SCAN_MODE_LOW_LATENCY.

        Parameters:
        scanMode - the scanMode to set
        Returns:
        true if a valid scanMode was provided, otherwise false

      • scanForPeripheralsWithServices

        public void scanForPeripheralsWithServices(@NotNull
                                           @NotNull java.util.UUID[] serviceUUIDs)
        Scan for peripherals that advertise at least one of the specified service UUIDs.
        Parameters:
        serviceUUIDs - an array of service UUIDs

      • scanForPeripheralsWithNames

        public void scanForPeripheralsWithNames(@NotNull
                                        @NotNull java.lang.String[] peripheralNames)
        Scan for peripherals with advertisement names containing any of the specified peripheral names.

        Substring matching is used so only a partial peripheral names has to be supplied.

        Parameters:
        peripheralNames - array of partial peripheral names

      • scanForPeripheralsWithAddresses

        public void scanForPeripheralsWithAddresses(@NotNull
                                            @NotNull java.lang.String[] peripheralAddresses)
        Scan for peripherals that have any of the specified peripheral mac addresses.
        Parameters:
        peripheralAddresses - array of peripheral mac addresses to scan for

      • isScanning

        public boolean isScanning()
        Check if a scanning is active

        true if a scan is active, otherwise false

      • connectPeripheral

        public void connectPeripheral(@NotNull
                              @NotNull BluetoothPeripheral peripheral,
                              @NotNull
                              @NotNull BluetoothPeripheralCallback peripheralCallback)
        Connect to a known peripheral immediately. The peripheral must have been found by scanning for this call to succeed. This method will time out in max 30 seconds on most phones and in 5 seconds on Samsung phones. If the peripheral is already connected, no connection attempt will be made. This method is asynchronous and there can be only one outstanding connect.
        Parameters:
        peripheral - BLE peripheral to connect with

      • autoConnectPeripheral

        public void autoConnectPeripheral(@NotNull
                                  @NotNull BluetoothPeripheral peripheral,
                                  @NotNull
                                  @NotNull BluetoothPeripheralCallback peripheralCallback)
        Automatically connect to a peripheral when it is advertising. It is not necessary to scan for the peripheral first. This call is asynchronous and will not time out.
        Parameters:
        peripheral - the peripheral

      • cancelConnection

        public void cancelConnection(@NotNull
                             @NotNull BluetoothPeripheral peripheral)
        Cancel an active or pending connection for a peripheral.
        Parameters:
        peripheral - the peripheral

      • autoConnectPeripheralsBatch

        public void autoConnectPeripheralsBatch(@NotNull
                                        @NotNull java.util.Map<BluetoothPeripheral,BluetoothPeripheralCallback> batch)
        Autoconnect to a batch of peripherals.

        Use this function to autoConnect to a batch of peripherals, instead of calling autoConnect on each of them. Calling autoConnect on many peripherals may cause Android scanning limits to kick in, which is avoided by using autoConnectPeripheralsBatch.

        Parameters:
        batch - the map of peripherals and their callbacks to autoconnect to

      • getPeripheral

        @NotNull
public @NotNull BluetoothPeripheral getPeripheral(@NotNull
                                                           @NotNull java.lang.String peripheralAddress)
        Get a peripheral object matching the specified mac address.
        Parameters:
        peripheralAddress - mac address
        Returns:
        a BluetoothPeripheral object matching the specified mac address or null if it was not found

      • getConnectedPeripherals

public @NotNull java.util.List<BluetoothPeripheral> getConnectedPeripherals()

        Returns:
        list of connected peripherals

      • isBluetoothEnabled

        public boolean isBluetoothEnabled()
        Check if Bluetooth is enabled
        Returns:
        true is Bluetooth is enabled, otherwise false

      • setPinCodeForPeripheral

        public boolean setPinCodeForPeripheral(@NotNull
                                       @NotNull java.lang.String peripheralAddress,
                                       @NotNull
                                       @NotNull java.lang.String pin)
        Set a fixed PIN code for a peripheral that asks fir a PIN code during bonding.

        This PIN code will be used to programmatically bond with the peripheral when it asks for a PIN code. Note that this only works for peripherals with a fixed PIN code.

        Parameters:
        peripheralAddress - the address of the peripheral
        pin - the 6 digit PIN code as a string, e.g. "123456"
        Returns:
        true if the pin code and peripheral address are valid and stored internally

      • removeBond

        public boolean removeBond(@NotNull
                          @NotNull java.lang.String peripheralAddress)
        Remove bond for a peripheral.
        Parameters:
        peripheralAddress - the address of the peripheral
        Returns:
        true if the peripheral was succesfully unpaired or it wasn't paired, false if it was paired and removing it failed

      • startPairingPopupHack

        public void startPairingPopupHack()
        Make the pairing popup appear in the foreground by doing a 1 sec discovery.

        If the pairing popup is shown within 60 seconds, it will be shown in the foreground.
